sentences.english: Alliance flight path between Booty Bay and Stormwind goes through a tree.
sentences.chinese: 聯盟從藏寶海灣到暴風城的飛行路線會穿越一棵樹。

sentences.english: A broken wood bridge, looked like was damaged by the thunderstorm.
sentences.chinese: 一個斷裂的木橋，看上去象是被暴風雨沖垮的。

sentences.english: There's a storm coming, so let's sheet in the sail.
sentences.chinese: 暴風雨要來了，咱們收帆吧。

sentences.english: Its crew consisted of themselves and a boy to assist---truly a poor equipment with which to face a great and stormy ocean like the Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 這隻裝備簡陋的小船，就要駛向太平洋的暴風雨了。

sentences.english: The soldiers laboured their way in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們在暴風雨中喫力地前進。

sentences.english: Climate-induced storm surges will have similar impacts.
sentences.chinese: 氣候引發的暴風潮也會造成類似影響。

sentences.english: The old building fell down in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那棟舊樓在暴風雨中倒塌了。

sentences.english: Before most big storms there is that moment of calm.
sentences.chinese: 在大多數暴風來臨之前總有一段時間風平浪靜。

sentences.english: Many trees were overthrown by the storm.
sentences.chinese: 許多樹被暴風雨刮倒了。

sentences.english: St. Joseph lighthouse after a winter storm.
As l struggled through the snowdrifts, l had just about reached the lowest Point in my life.
sentences.chinese: 處在人生低谷的我在暴風雪中艱難地行走着。

sentences.english: The clouds warned that a storm was coming.
sentences.chinese: 烏雲預示着將有暴風雨來臨。

sentences.english: Chicago endured blizzard conditions and thundersnow, along with half a meter of snow accumulation.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥處於暴風雪和雷暴天氣，會有半米左右的積雪。

sentences.english: The ship was at the mercy of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那隻船在暴風雨中失去控制。

sentences.english: The latest round of storms also battered Zhengzhou, capital of Henan Province.
sentences.chinese: 最新一輪的暴風雨還襲擊了河南省會鄭州。

sentences.english: However, as the storm impact, the train on and off.
sentences.chinese: 但由於暴風雪影響，該列車時開時停。

definition: storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
to rake with machine gunfire/to strafe/to machine-gun down
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
horseman/cavalryman/knight (i.e. European nobility)/(Tw) bike rider (scooter, bicycle etc)
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
